definitions.definition: not at any time; not on any occasion

examples.text: You never help me.
He'll never forget her.
He has never been abroad.
She had never seen so much snow.
She left the country, vowing never to return again.
‘Would you vote for him?’ ‘Never.’
‘I work for a company called Orion Technology.’ ‘Never heard of them.’
**Never in all my life** have I seen such a horrible thing.
**Never ever** tell anyone your password.
**Never before** has English cuisine been so stylish.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize a negative statement instead of ‘not’
definitions.labels: (especially British English)(especially British English)(British English, slang)(old-fashioned or humorous)

examples.text: I **never knew** *(= didn't know until now)* you had a twin sister.
I never realized just how easy it is.
Someone might find out, and that **would never do** *(= that is not acceptable)*.
He **never so much as** smiled *(= did not smile even once)*.
Most people have **never even** heard of Iggy.
‘I told my boss exactly what I thought of her.’ ‘You never did!’ *(= ‘Surely you didn't!’)*
‘You took my bike.’ ‘No, I never.’
**Never fear** *(= Do not worry)*, everything will be all right.

definitions.definition: used to say that nothing is impossible

examples.text: Many thought the book could not become a movie, but with Hollywood never say never.

definitions.definition: on hire purchase (= by making payments over a long period)

examples.text: to buy a new car on the never-never

definitions.definition: used to express surprise or disapproval

examples.text: Well, I never! Fancy getting married and not telling us!

wordOrigin: Old English nǣfre, from ne ‘not’ + ǣfre ‘ever’.
